name: Public Procurement Act
description: Key provisions of the Public Procurement Act 2007, covering objectives, procedures, methods, thresholds, and penalties.

questions.question: In which year was the Public Procurement Act enacted in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: The Public Procurement Act was enacted in 2007 to regulate public procurement practices in Nigeria.

questions.question: Which body is established by the Public Procurement Act to oversee procurement in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: The Bureau of Public Procurement (BPP) is established under the Act as the regulatory authority for procurement.

questions.question: Which section of the PPA 2007 establishes the Bureau of Public Procurement?
questions.explanation: Section 3 of the PPA 2007 establishes the Bureau of Public Procurement (BPP).

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an objective of the Public Procurement Act?
questions.explanation: The Act seeks to promote transparency, competition, efficiency, and value for money, not corruption.

questions.question: Which section of the Act prohibits splitting of contracts to circumvent approval thresholds?
questions.explanation: Section 16 prohibits splitting of contracts to evade approval thresholds.

questions.question: Which section requires procurement to be based on principles of transparency, accountability, and fairness?
questions.explanation: Section 16 emphasizes transparency, accountability, fairness, and competition in procurement.

questions.question: Which procurement method is considered the default under the PPA?
questions.explanation: Open Competitive Bidding is the default procurement method under Section 24 of the PPA 2007.

questions.question: What is the minimum time frame for submission of bids under national competitive bidding?
questions.explanation: Section 25 requires at least 4 weeks for submission of bids under national competitive bidding.

questions.question: Which section empowers the BPP to issue guidelines and regulations?
questions.explanation: Section 5 gives BPP the power to issue guidelines, manuals, and regulations for procurement.

questions.question: Which section requires all procuring entities to have a procurement planning committee?
questions.explanation: Section 21 requires every procuring entity to have a procurement planning committee.

questions.question: Who chairs the Procurement Planning Committee of a Ministry?
questions.explanation: The Procurement Planning Committee is chaired by the Permanent Secretary or Chief Executive Officer of the procuring entity.

questions.question: Which section stipulates that all procurement above certain thresholds must be advertised?
questions.explanation: Section 23 requires advertisement of all procurements above the set thresholds.

questions.question: What is the role of the Procurement Unit in a Ministry?
options: Prepare bidding documents and manage procurement processes
questions.explanation: Procurement Units prepare bidding documents, manage processes, and support the Procurement Planning Committee.

questions.question: Which section provides for the establishment of procurement journals?
questions.explanation: Section 12 mandates the publication of procurement journals to ensure wide dissemination of information.

questions.question: Which section provides for international competitive bidding where necessary?
questions.explanation: Section 27 provides for international competitive bidding when national competitive bidding is inadequate.

questions.question: Which section prohibits conflict of interest in procurement proceedings?
questions.explanation: Section 57 prohibits conflict of interest and mandates disclosure of potential conflicts by officials.

questions.question: Which section requires bid security for procurement of goods and works?
questions.explanation: Section 28 requires bid security to be submitted with bids for goods and works procurement.

questions.question: What is the validity period for bids unless otherwise specified?
questions.explanation: Section 26 provides that bids shall remain valid for 60 days unless otherwise stated.

questions.question: Which section deals with pre-qualification of bidders?
questions.explanation: Section 22 provides for pre-qualification of bidders to ensure capability before submission of bids.

questions.question: Which section requires evaluation of bids to be based only on criteria in the solicitation documents?
questions.explanation: Section 33 mandates that evaluation of bids must be based strictly on criteria stated in solicitation documents.

questions.question: Which section mandates the publication of contract awards above certain thresholds?
questions.explanation: Section 32 requires publication of contract awards above thresholds to ensure transparency.

questions.question: Which section of the Act defines procurement thresholds and approval limits?
questions.explanation: Section 16 establishes procurement thresholds and approval requirements for entities.

questions.question: Which section stipulates the contents of standard bidding documents?
questions.explanation: Section 25 requires procuring entities to use standard bidding documents containing clear specifications and criteria.

questions.question: Which procurement method is allowed in emergencies?
questions.explanation: Direct Procurement under Section 42 is allowed in emergencies where competitive bidding is impractical.

questions.question: Which section requires the use of domestic preference where applicable?
questions.explanation: Section 35 allows for domestic preference in procurement to support local industry.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of bid opening?
options: To announce bid prices and ensure transparency
questions.explanation: Bid opening ensures transparency by publicly announcing bid prices and bidders' names.

questions.question: Which section of the PPA provides for restricted tendering?
questions.explanation: Section 40 allows restricted tendering when goods or services are available only from a limited number of suppliers.

questions.question: Which section requires contractors to possess the professional and technical qualifications necessary for contract execution?
questions.explanation: Section 16 mandates that bidders must have the capacity and qualifications to perform contracts.

questions.question: Which section requires a bid security to protect against withdrawal or failure to sign a contract?
questions.explanation: Section 28 provides for bid securities to protect procuring entities from default by bidders.

questions.question: Which section covers the rejection of all bids if they fail to meet required standards?
questions.explanation: Section 31 allows rejection of all bids if none meets the required standards or criteria.

questions.question: Which section provides for negotiations in procurement?
questions.explanation: Section 36 permits negotiations only under limited circumstances, such as single-source procurement.

questions.question: Which section provides for community and small-scale procurement?
questions.explanation: Section 39 provides for community participation in small-scale procurement to encourage local development.

questions.question: Which section requires bid opening to be conducted in public?
questions.explanation: Section 27 requires that bid opening must be done publicly to ensure fairness and transparency.

questions.question: Which section provides for direct procurement in cases of national emergency?
questions.explanation: Section 42 allows direct procurement during emergencies to prevent delays.

questions.question: Which section provides that the lowest evaluated responsive bid should be awarded the contract?
questions.explanation: Section 33 requires awarding the contract to the lowest evaluated responsive bid.

questions.question: Which section empowers the BPP to maintain a database of contractors and service providers?
questions.explanation: Section 5 and 9 empower the BPP to maintain and update a national database of contractors.

questions.question: Which section provides for a complaint mechanism for aggrieved bidders?
questions.explanation: Section 54 provides a complaint mechanism for bidders to seek administrative review.

questions.question: Which section allows for suspension of procurement proceedings if irregularities are found?
questions.explanation: Section 53 empowers the BPP to suspend procurement if irregularities are detected.

questions.question: Which section prohibits officials from accepting gifts from contractors?
questions.explanation: Section 57 prohibits conflict of interest and forbids officials from receiving gifts or favors.

questions.question: Which section prescribes penalties for conspiracy to rig bids?
questions.explanation: Section 58 prescribes penalties for bid-rigging, fraud, and collusion in procurement.

questions.question: Which section provides for administrative review of procurement proceedings?
questions.explanation: Section 54 provides for administrative review where aggrieved bidders may challenge procurement decisions.

questions.question: Which section of the PPA 2007 prohibits fraudulent practices in procurement?
questions.explanation: Section 58 prohibits corrupt and fraudulent practices such as misrepresentation and collusion.

questions.question: Which section empowers the BPP to issue certificates of 'No Objection' to contract award?
questions.explanation: Section 5 empowers the BPP to issue a 'Certificate of No Objection' before a contract award can be finalized.

questions.question: Which section requires contractors to possess financial capability to perform contracts?
questions.explanation: Section 16 requires contractors to demonstrate financial capability as part of eligibility criteria.

questions.question: Which section prohibits bid rigging and collusive practices?
questions.explanation: Section 58 prescribes penalties for bid rigging, collusion, and other anti-competitive practices.

questions.question: Which section states that contractors must not be in receivership or insolvency?
questions.explanation: Section 16 states that eligible contractors must not be in receivership, bankruptcy, or insolvency.

questions.question: Which section allows cancellation of a procurement proceeding before award?
questions.explanation: Section 31 provides that procurement proceedings may be cancelled at any time before contract award if necessary.

questions.question: Which section provides guidelines for contract implementation and supervision?
questions.explanation: Section 35 provides guidelines for proper contract implementation and monitoring by procuring entities.

questions.question: Which section empowers the BPP to debar contractors for malpractice?
questions.explanation: Section 57 empowers the BPP to debar contractors who engage in fraudulent or corrupt practices.

questions.question: Which section allows the use of procurement consultants?
questions.explanation: Section 45 provides for the engagement of procurement consultants to assist procuring entities.

questions.question: Which section provides that procurement must be based on approved budgetary provision?
questions.explanation: Section 14 prohibits procurement without approved budgetary provision and availability of funds.

questions.question: Which section prohibits alteration of procurement documents after bid opening?
questions.explanation: Section 33 prohibits alteration of procurement documents once bids have been opened.

questions.question: Which section requires that contractors must have fulfilled tax obligations?
questions.explanation: Section 16 requires bidders to have fulfilled obligations regarding taxes, pensions, and social security contributions.

questions.question: Which section emphasizes record keeping of procurement proceedings?
questions.explanation: Section 34 requires procuring entities to keep detailed records of procurement proceedings for accountability.

questions.question: Which section deals with the use of electronic procurement (e-procurement)?
questions.explanation: Section 38 provides for electronic procurement systems to enhance efficiency and transparency.

questions.question: Which section covers procurement of consultant services?
questions.explanation: Section 43 provides procedures for procuring consultant services, including selection and negotiation.

questions.question: Which section states that contract award decisions must be communicated to unsuccessful bidders?
questions.explanation: Section 30 requires notifying unsuccessful bidders of contract award decisions to ensure transparency.

questions.question: Which section allows for framework agreements in procurement?
questions.explanation: Section 44 provides for framework agreements to allow repeated procurements under pre-agreed terms.

questions.question: Which section provides that contractors must have no record of criminal conviction for fraud?
questions.explanation: Section 16 requires bidders to have no record of criminal conviction for fraud, corruption, or misrepresentation.

questions.question: Which section provides that contract performance must be monitored to ensure compliance?
questions.explanation: Section 35 requires monitoring of contract performance to ensure delivery in line with contract terms.

questions.question: Which section of the PPA provides that procuring entities must maintain proper procurement records?
questions.explanation: Section 34 requires procuring entities to maintain detailed procurement records.

questions.question: Which section covers the use of selective tendering?
questions.explanation: Section 40 provides for selective tendering when only a few suppliers are qualified.

questions.question: Which section provides for international competitive bidding?
questions.explanation: Section 27 provides for international competitive bidding when goods and services are not available locally.

questions.question: Which section provides that all procurement shall be conducted by open competitive bidding as default?
questions.explanation: Section 24 makes open competitive bidding the default method of procurement.

questions.question: Which section empowers the BPP to inspect procurement documents of entities?
questions.explanation: Section 5 empowers the BPP to inspect procurement records to ensure compliance.

questions.question: Which section requires that contract awards above a certain threshold must have 'No Objection' from BPP?
questions.explanation: Section 5 mandates BPP to issue a 'Certificate of No Objection' for high-value procurements.

questions.question: Which section empowers the BPP to blacklist contractors?
questions.explanation: Section 57 empowers the BPP to blacklist or debar contractors found guilty of misconduct.

questions.question: Which section prohibits splitting contracts to avoid thresholds?
questions.explanation: Section 16 prohibits contract splitting to circumvent procurement thresholds.

questions.question: Which section provides that procurement planning must be based on approved budgets?
questions.explanation: Section 14 requires procurement planning to be backed by budgetary provisions.

questions.question: Which section provides for emergency procurement without competitive bidding?
questions.explanation: Section 42 allows emergency procurement where delay would be detrimental.

questions.question: Which section provides penalties for procurement fraud?
questions.explanation: Section 58 prescribes penalties for fraud, misrepresentation, and bid-rigging.

questions.question: Which section provides that procurement must not commence without appropriation?
questions.explanation: Section 14 prohibits procurement without appropriation and funds in place.

questions.question: Which section requires that all bidders be treated fairly and equitably?
questions.explanation: Section 16 requires equal and fair treatment of all bidders during procurement.

questions.question: Which section requires public advertisement of procurement opportunities?
questions.explanation: Section 23 requires advertisement of procurement opportunities above thresholds.

questions.question: Which section covers domestic preference to encourage Nigerian goods?
questions.explanation: Section 35 allows domestic preference to encourage use of Nigerian goods.

questions.question: Which section provides guidelines for bid evaluation?
questions.explanation: Section 33 provides criteria and guidelines for evaluating bids.

questions.question: Which section prohibits procurement officials from having personal interests in contracts?
questions.explanation: Section 57 prohibits conflict of interest for procurement officials.

questions.question: Which section provides for sanctions against defaulting suppliers?
questions.explanation: Section 59 prescribes sanctions for defaulting contractors and suppliers.

questions.question: Which section requires that contract awards be based on responsiveness and lowest evaluated price?
questions.explanation: Section 33 mandates awards to the lowest responsive and evaluated bidder.

questions.question: Which section prescribes penalties for procurement officers who breach the Act?
questions.explanation: Section 58 prescribes penalties for officers who breach procurement rules.

questions.question: Which section prohibits contract splitting to avoid oversight?
questions.explanation: Section 16 prohibits splitting contracts to evade approval thresholds.

questions.question: Which section prescribes imprisonment for procurement fraud?
questions.explanation: Section 58 prescribes imprisonment and fines for procurement-related fraud.

questions.question: Which section empowers the BPP to cancel a procurement proceeding?
questions.explanation: Section 53 allows the BPP to cancel proceedings where irregularities are discovered.

questions.question: Which section provides that unsuccessful bidders may seek judicial review?
questions.explanation: Section 54 allows aggrieved bidders to escalate complaints to judicial review after administrative review.

questions.question: Which section requires procurement entities to advertise in national newspapers?
questions.explanation: Section 23 requires advertisement in widely circulated national newspapers.

questions.question: Which section emphasizes efficiency and timeliness in procurement?
questions.explanation: Section 16 emphasizes efficiency, timeliness, and value for money in procurement.

questions.question: Which section provides for contract performance securities?
questions.explanation: Section 29 provides for performance securities to ensure contractors fulfill obligations.

questions.question: Which section covers bid validity periods?
questions.explanation: Section 26 provides for bid validity periods to ensure fairness and stability of offers.

questions.question: Which section provides that procurement must achieve value for money?
questions.explanation: Section 16 emphasizes that procurement must achieve value for money.

questions.question: Which section requires publication of procurement guidelines by BPP?
questions.explanation: Section 5 empowers the BPP to issue procurement guidelines.

questions.question: Which section covers procurement audits by BPP?
questions.explanation: Section 6 empowers BPP to conduct procurement audits.

questions.question: Which section provides penalties for contractors who abandon projects?
questions.explanation: Section 59 prescribes sanctions for contractors who abandon projects.

questions.question: Which section mandates capacity building for procurement officers?
questions.explanation: Section 5 empowers the BPP to organize training and build capacity of procurement officers.

questions.question: Which section provides for dispute resolution mechanisms?
questions.explanation: Section 54 provides mechanisms for resolving disputes in procurement.

questions.question: Which section allows blacklisting of bidders for corrupt practices?
questions.explanation: Section 57 empowers the BPP to blacklist bidders for engaging in corrupt practices.

questions.question: Which section requires contracts to be implemented efficiently and in good faith?
questions.explanation: Section 35 emphasizes efficient and good faith implementation of contracts.

questions.question: Which section prescribes sanctions for collusion among bidders?
questions.explanation: Section 58 prescribes sanctions for collusion, fraud, and bid rigging.

questions.question: Which section covers public access to procurement records?
questions.explanation: Section 32 provides for public access to procurement records and contract awards.

questions.question: Which section provides that all procurement decisions must be documented?
questions.explanation: Section 34 requires that all procurement decisions be properly documented.

questions.question: Which section provides for e-procurement systems?
questions.explanation: Section 38 provides for the use of e-procurement systems in public procurement.

questions.question: What is the main objective of the Public Procurement Act?
options: To ensure transparency, accountability, and value for money
questions.explanation: The Public Procurement Act aims to ensure transparency, accountability, and value for money in public procurement.

questions.question: Which body is responsible for regulating public procurement in Nigeria?
questions.explanation: The Bureau of Public Procurement (BPP) regulates public procurement in Nigeria.

questions.question: What is the threshold for competitive bidding in public procurement?
questions.explanation: Competitive bidding is required for contracts above ₦10 million.

questions.question: Which procurement method involves inviting a limited number of pre-qualified contractors?
questions.explanation: Selective tendering involves inviting a limited number of pre-qualified contractors.

questions.question: What is the maximum period for bid validity in public procurement?
questions.explanation: Bid validity period is typically 90 days, extendable with bidder consent.
